**Joanna C. Going**[1] (born July 22, 1963) is an American actress.

## Early
life[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Joanna_Going&action=edit&section=1&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: Early life")]

She was born in Washington, DC, the oldest of six children of a lawyer/state
assemblyman father and a police dispatcher mother.[1] Raised in [Newport,
Rhode Island](/wiki/Newport,_Rhode_Island "Newport, Rhode Island"), she
graduated from [Rogers High
School](/wiki/Rogers_High_School_\(Newport,_Rhode_Island\) "Rogers High School
\(Newport, Rhode Island\)") in 1981, then attended [Emerson
College](/wiki/Emerson_College "Emerson College") for two years before
studying at the [American Academy of Dramatic
Arts](/wiki/American_Academy_of_Dramatic_Arts "American Academy of Dramatic
Arts").[_[citation needed](/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed "Wikipedia:Citation
needed")_]

##
Career[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Joanna_Going&action=edit&section=2&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: Career")]

Going appeared in soap opera roles in the late 1980s, most notably as Lisa
Grady on _[Another World](/wiki/Another_World_\(TV_series\) "Another World
\(TV series\)")_ from 1987 to 1989.[2] She went on to portray lead character
[Victoria Winters](/wiki/Victoria_Winters "Victoria Winters") in the 1991
primetime series _[Dark Shadows](/wiki/Dark_Shadows_\(1991_TV_series\) "Dark
Shadows \(1991 TV series\)")_.[2] Going later starred in short-lived
television series _[Going to Extremes](/wiki/Going_to_Extremes "Going to
Extremes")_ and guest-starred on _[Columbo](/wiki/Columbo "Columbo")_ , _[Spin
City](/wiki/Spin_City "Spin City")_ , _[The Outer
Limits](/wiki/The_Outer_Limits_\(1995_TV_series\) "The Outer Limits \(1995 TV
series\)")_ , and _[Law& Order](/wiki/Law_%26_Order "Law & Order")_.

Going starred in a number of feature films. She made her film debut in _[Wyatt
Earp](/wiki/Wyatt_Earp_\(film\) "Wyatt Earp \(film\)")_ (1994) as [Josephine
Marcus](/wiki/Josephine_Earp "Josephine Earp"), and later had major roles in
_Eden_ , _[Keys to Tulsa](/wiki/Keys_to_Tulsa "Keys to Tulsa")_ , _[Inventing
the Abbotts](/wiki/Inventing_the_Abbotts "Inventing the Abbotts")_ , and
_[Still Breathing](/wiki/Still_Breathing_\(film\) "Still Breathing
\(film\)")_. Her biggest role may be in the 1998 film version of
_[Phantoms](/wiki/Phantoms_\(film\) "Phantoms \(film\)")_. In the 2000s, she
starred in several television films and guest-starred on _[CSI: Crime Scene
Investigation](/wiki/CSI:_Crime_Scene_Investigation "CSI: Crime Scene
Investigation")_ , _[Criminal Minds](/wiki/Criminal_Minds "Criminal Minds")_ ,
and _[Mad Men](/wiki/Mad_Men "Mad Men")_. She also appeared opposite [Sean
Penn](/wiki/Sean_Penn "Sean Penn") in the 2011 film _[The Tree of
Life](/wiki/The_Tree_of_Life_\(film\) "The Tree of Life \(film\)")_ , her
first role in a major motion picture since 2003's _[Runaway
Jury](/wiki/Runaway_Jury "Runaway Jury")_. In 2014, Going starred as First
Lady Tricia Walker in the second season of [Netflix](/wiki/Netflix "Netflix")
political series _[House of Cards](/wiki/House_of_Cards_\(U.S._TV_series\)
"House of Cards \(U.S. TV series\)")_. She later was cast in the
[DirecTV](/wiki/DirecTV "DirecTV") series
_[Kingdom](/wiki/Kingdom_\(2014_TV_series\) "Kingdom \(2014 TV
series\)")_.[3][4][5]

Going appeared on [Ken Reid](/wiki/Ken_Reid_\(comedian\) "Ken Reid
\(comedian\)")'s _TV Guidance Counselor_ podcast on March 25, 2016.

## Personal
life[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Joanna_Going&action=edit&section=3&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: Personal life")]

Going married actor [Dylan Walsh](/wiki/Dylan_Walsh "Dylan Walsh") on October
10, 2004. They have a daughter, Stella Haven. On December 15, 2010, Walsh
announced he had filed for divorce.[6] The divorce was finalized in December
2012.[7]
